com.gensym.message
Class TraceOut

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.gensym.message.TraceOut
public class TraceOut
extends Object
implements MessageListener

The default simple tracer that sends its messages to standard out. It has its own way of adding itself as a listener that is called from within its initialize method. It can be added to an application in the following way: 

 // DECLARATION PROBABLY IN THE TOP LEVEL CLASS:
 private static TraceOut traceListener = new TraceOut();
 ...
 // PROBABLY DONE EARLY IN THE "main" METHOD:
   traceListener.initialize(traceKeys, traceLevel, messages);

See Also:
initialize(java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String)

Method Detail

setDebug

public static void setDebug(boolean on)

initialize

public void initialize(String keys,
                       int level,
                       String messages)
A simple initializer that set the debugging level fully on for all levels and classes for a key.
Parameters:
keys - a string containing keys separated by spaces, tokenized using the default StringTokenizer
level - the level of verbosity to be listened for. The higher the level, the more MessageEvents will be received.
messages - a string containing messageLookups separated by spaces tokenized using the default StringTokenizer. If null all messages will be printed out, otherwise, only those in messages will be.
See Also:
Message, MessageEvent, StringTokenizer

processMessageEvent

public void processMessageEvent(MessageEvent event)
sends messages to standard out. If debugging is enabled it prints stack traces for failed messages (messages that had no translation). Otherwise it prints it out preceded by "Untranslatable Message". If debugging is on, a stack trace is printed out for failed messages.
Specified by:
processMessageEvent in interface MessageListener
